result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:08 PM Defendant Zachary J. Larson in court with attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen.  Defendant Zachary J. Larson in custody.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin via zoom. Court has reviewed the PSI and Defense Memorandum. Atty Hatch and Lundeen have reviewed, no corrections. Hatch: victim's rights are in compliance.  Court instructs people via zoom to mute themselves. Atty Lundeen; believes Ct#2 should be vacated and is a clerical error. Court: deal with issue at the end of sentencing. Atty Lundeen addresses Motion. Court clarifies his decision. ADA Hatch gives sentencing argument: recommends 12-15 years initial confinement following by 8-10 years extended supervision. conditions: DNA sample, court costs, No contact with victim or her family, sex offender treatment and sex offender registry, counseling, no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18. Atty Lundeen gives sentencing argument; 1017 days credit. Requests 33 months.  Defendant addresses the court. Court asks each person their name, how they know Zachary and what they want the court to know about sentencing. Judy Lindsey appeared via phone; addresses court. Anthony Cole appears via zoom; addresses the court. Diana Marson appears via zoom; addresses the court. Jamie Schooley appeared in court; addresses the court. Mitchel Auchampach appeared via zoom; addresses the court. Laura Auchampach appeared via zoom; addresses the court. Melodie S appeared via zoom; addresses the court. April Noogle appeared via zoom; addresses the court. Tamryn Feist appeared in court; addresses the court. Jen Leacher appeared via zoom; addresses the court.  Atty Lundeen reads a text statement from Caleb Bowman. Inna Potapenko appeared via zoom; addresses court. Trianna Eubank appeared via zoom; addresses court. Dianna Lyng appeared via zoom; addresses court. Atty Hatch argues plea of Ct#2; 9 months jail concurrent to Ct#1. Atty Lundeen responds; no further argument. 2:46 court recesses. 2:54 court resumes. Court goes over the sentencing factors/requirements; class B felony. Court orders 15 years prison sentence: 5 years initial confinement followed by 10 years ES. court costs, DNA sample, follow through with Sex offender treatment, sex offender registry and maintain compliance with rules, no contact with victim (LR) or her father; any other no contact to be monitored by the Agent. F/T with any counseling or programming deemed approrpriate by Agent, no contact with any minors. 1017 days credit. Def addresses the court.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Court will decide on Ct#2 after written decision submitted by Atty Lundeen,

10:24 AM Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in Court.  ADA Kaley Walker (for DA Sean Froelich) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  VW Coordinator Sue Burr present.  Court notes case was set for Bond Modification although bond had been revoked.  Court notes case was set for hearing but State advised that victim was not contacted and hearing could not be held.  ADA Walker notes hearing was taken off the calendar and objects to any type of hearing, noting victim not present.  Court will allow Atty. Lundeen to make record.  Atty. Lundeen notes motion requested on 16CF15, 19CM246, and 18CF12.  COC office advised he was not attorney of record on 19CM246 & 18CF12.  States bond modification request was made due to holidays, PSI recd. 12/02.  Alternative PSI to be done so Sentencing was rescheduled.  States DA Froelich did not object to scheduling yesterday.  Defendant was present from Jail and taken back before he could speak with him.  ADA Walker states victim notification was not done, motion was filed yesterday and victim rights need to be complied with.  Atty. Lundeen requests to respond.  Court states no findings will be made today, notes alternative PSI requested.  Victim have a right to be present.  Atty. Lundeen responds, states response to his motion was not filed and he only found out hearing was cancelled through COC office.  Court responds, reiterates victim rights need to be complied with.  Adjourned at 10:46 AM

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zachary J. Larson in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Defendant Zachary J. Larson in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 18CF12 heard at this time.  Froelich: amended information filed on each case. 18CF12 Def will plea guilty. 3 years probation: 30 days jail,  sex offender treatment. restitution to be held open for 5 years. no contact with LMR, April Noggle, Robert Dootson, Jamie Hodkins. seek counseling. 16CF15 guilty to Ct#1 with a DJOC for 5 years. guilty to Ct#2. 3 years probation; concurrent to 18CF12, 30 days jail,  same conditions as 18CF12. expungement on both cases if successfully completes probation. 99 days credit on 18CF12 if the Defendant is revoked. Atty Schlough and Def agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 and #2 in 16CF15 and Ct#1 in 18CF12; Schlough stipulates to factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of Ct#2 in 16CF15 and Ct#1 in 18CF12. Court finds Def guilty of Ct#1 in 16CF15.  Court withholds judgment of conviction of Ct#1 in 16CF15.  Froelich: victims rights have been complied with. Atty Froelich gives sentencing argument. Atty Schlough gives sentencing argument; no jail or stay jail time to be used at the discretion of the Agent. Requests work release. Defendant addresses the court.  Court goes over sentencing factors.

 Court: S/W 3 years probation on Ct#1 18CF12 conditions: 12 months jail with 1st 3 months without work release, remaining with work release, Agent to make an assessment sex offender treatment and complete any treatment as order by Agent, restitution to be held open for 5 years, no contact with LMR, April Noggle, Robert Dootson, Jamie Hodkins. MAR and LRD.  99 days credit if revoked. Court costs and DNA sample. Expungment if Def successfully completes probation. 
Court: S/W 3 years probation on Ct#2 16CF15; concurrent with 18CF12 conditions: 30 days jail concurrent with 18CF12, Agent to makean assessment for sex offender treatment and complete any treatment as ordered by Agent, restitution to be held open for 5 years, no contact with LMR, April Noggle, Robert Dootson, Jamie Hodkins, MAR and LRD. Court costs and DNA sample. Expungment if Def successfully completes probation.
Court approves the DJOC on Ct#1 in 16CF15. Signs.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 3:43
